messages.message:
Hi Anil, api-server doesn’t start on sandbox, can you look into it whenever you get a chance and suggest how I can debug further or fix it?

It fails on
```67.18 Failed to build blis
67.26 error: failed-wheel-build-for-install
67.26
67.26 × Failed to build installable wheels for some pyproject.toml based projects
67.26 ╰─> blis
------
Dockerfile:13
--------------------
  12 |     COPY requirements.txt /tmp/
  13 | >>> RUN apk add --no-cache \
  14 | >>>         build-base \
  15 | >>>         git \
  16 | >>>     && pip install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip setuptools wheel \
  17 | >>>     && pip install --no-cache-dir -r /tmp/requirements.txt \
  18 | >>>     && rm -rf /usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/spacy/tests/* \
  19 | >>>     && apk del --no-cache --purge --rdepends \
  20 | >>>         build-base \
  21 | >>>         git \
  22 | >>>     && rm -rf \
  23 | >>>         /tmp/requirements.txt \
  24 | >>>     && if [ "$USE_DEBUGPY" = "true" ]; then \
  25 | >>>         pip install debugpy; \
  26 | >>>     fi
  27 |
--------------------
ERROR: failed to build: failed to solve: process "/bin/sh -c apk add --no-cache         build-base         git     && pip install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip setuptools wheel     && pip install --no-cache-dir -r /tmp/requirements.txt     && rm -rf /usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/spacy/tests/*     && apk del --no-cache --purge --rdepends         build-base         git     && rm -rf         /tmp/requirements.txt     && if [ \"$USE_DEBUGPY\" = \"true\" ]; then         pip install debugpy;     fi" did not complete successfully: exit code: 1```
blis is c++ based python package
it is a pain - let me take a look in like 15-20 mins
